021import net.tnemc.paper.PaperCore;
022import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.scheduler.Chore;
023import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.scheduler.ChoreExecution;
024import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.scheduler.ChoreTime;
025import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.scheduler.SchedulerProvider;
026import org.bukkit.Bukkit;
027
028import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
029
030/**
031 * FoliaScheduler
032 *
033 * @author creatorfromhell
034 * @since 0.1.2.0
035 */
036public class FoliaScheduler extends SchedulerProvider<FoliaChore> {
037
038  /**
039   * Used to create a task, which will execute after the specified delay.
040   *
041   * @param task        The task to run.
042   * @param delay       The delay, in ticks.
043   * @param environment The execution environment for the task.
044   */
045  @Override
046  public void createDelayedTask(final Runnable task, final ChoreTime delay, final ChoreExecution environment) {
047    //we divide the delay by 20 because Folia uses seconds, and the delay is sent in ticks.
048    Bukkit.getAsyncScheduler().runDelayed(PaperCore.instance().getPlugin(), (scheduledTask)->task.run(), delay.asSeconds(), TimeUnit.SECONDS);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Used to create a task, which repeats after a specified period.
053   *
054   * @param task        The task to run.
055   * @param delay       The delay to run the task, in ticks.
056   * @param period      The period to run the task.
057   * @param environment The execution environment for the task.
058   *
059   * @return The associated {@link Chore} with this task.
060   */
061  @Override
062  public FoliaChore createRepeatingTask(final Runnable task, final ChoreTime delay, final ChoreTime period, final ChoreExecution environment) {
063
064    return new FoliaChore(Bukkit.getAsyncScheduler()
065                                  .runAtFixedRate(PaperCore.instance().getPlugin(), (scheduledTask)->task.run(),
066                                                  delay.asSeconds(), period.asSeconds(), TimeUnit.SECONDS),
067                          environment);
068  }
069}
